doc.title: ibe160 - Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: The system shall allow users to easily log the consumption status of their planned meals. Users can mark a planned meal as "Eaten" or "Skipped".

doc.title: ibe160 - Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: The system shall provide a clear, minimalist dashboard displaying the user's current weekly workout and meal plans. Dashboard visually indicates completed/skipped workouts and meals.

doc.section: Detailed Design: Data Models and Contracts
doc.snippet: The `meal_log` table records the consumption status of individual meals, including `id`, `user_id`, `meal_plan_id`, `meal_id`, `status`, `logged_at`.

doc.title: Epic Technical Specification: Adaptive Planning & Progress Logging
doc.snippet: POST /log/meal: Logs the consumption status of a single meal. Request Body: `{ "meal_plan_id": "...", "meal_id": "...", "status": "eaten" }`.

artifact.reason: UI for displaying daily meal plan and logging consumption status.
API endpoint to store meal log data.
Database model for recording meal consumption status.

constraints.constraint: UI components for meal logging must be created within `frontend/src/app/(dashboard)/meals/` directory.
Backend endpoint to store meal log data must be added to `backend/app/api/v1/endpoints/plans.py`.
UI should be simple and quick to use for logging meals.
Each logging action on the frontend triggers an API call to `POST /log/meal`.
Consider implementing optimistic UI updates for enhanced user experience.
The `meal_log` table must conform to the defined data model, including `status`.

tests.standards: Backend unit and integration tests will use Pytest. Frontend component and integration tests will use React Testing Library with Jest. E2E tests will utilize Playwright. Test files will be co-located with components or in root `tests/` directory for backend.
